item.title: HTML Rules
item.description: Under the hood, most of the accessibility checks ran by Ace are powered by aXe, an engine for automated testing of HTML. Ace uses aXe’s rules, with some modifications (described here). Rules Here is a list of aXe’s rules used by Ace, taken from their documentation: Rule Description accesskeys Ensures every accesskey attribute value is unique. area-alt Ensures <area> elements of image maps have alternate text.

item.title: EPUB Rules
item.description: In addition to the HTML rules, Ace has a set of rules that are EPUB-specific: Rule Description epub-pagesource Ensures that if the content has page breaks, the print source is identified in the Package Document metadata with dc:source. epub-title Ensures that the EPUBâ€™s title is defined in the Package Document. epub-type-has-matching-role Ensures that the element has an ARIA role matching its epub:type.
